Tom Emerson wrote:
> Right now Heritrix defines ${HOSTNAME} for path substitutions, but it
> would be useful (to me, at least) to have others. For example, if I
> have a separate directory for my state or arc files (say on a
> different disk) they all get written at the top level of that directory.
> 
> What if i could specify a path like:
> 
> /Volumes/Brahman/Crawler/{$JOBNAME}
> 
> That would allow heritrix to construct job-unique file names from a
> common profile.
> 
> I don't mind adding support for this, if others think it may be
> useful.
> 
> Does this make any sense? I'm fighting the flu so it may not... I'm
> not exactly coherent right now.

Makes sense Tom.  If you want to send over a patch, that'd be 
appreciated though I'd say doing it right might be a bit of work.  As it 
is currently, the HOSTNAME substitution is done off in 
ARCWriterProcessor only 
(http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/writer/ARCWriterProcessor.html#613). 
If you put ${HOSTNAME} elsewhere in an order file, its not interpolated.

Would be better if there was a generalized variable substitution for 
order files that lived back in the settings system.  Can you think of 
other variables you'd like to see available as options when filling out 
an order file? JOBNAME, HOSTNAME, and possibly PORT seem most obvious, 
with perhaps even name used to register heritrix over in JNDI -- a name 
that will uniquely identify instances -- also?  Would making it so you 
could do "${order-xml-element-attribute-name}" -- e.g. ${disk-path} -- 
anywhere in an order file element value and have it replaced with that 
elements value be overkill?  Probably.  How about ${KEY} where KEY is a 
system property read off the command-line?

Meantime I've made an RFE: 
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1429393&group_id=73833&atid=539102

> 
> Also, I looked for a discussion in the User's Manual for the various
> *-path settings, but didn't find them. Surely I'm missing them?
> 
No. There doesn't seem to be discussion of these fields in the user 
manual.  The user manual avoids this level of detail.  I suppose thought 
is if you need specifics for a particular setting, you can read the 
description in the WUI. Should we add description of a base set of order 
fields?  If only the descriptions from the order file?

Yours,
St.Ack
